name: Pilot
description: A pair of socially awkward theoretical physicists meet their new neighbor Penny, who is their polar opposite.

name: The Big Bran Hypothesis
description: Penny is furious with Leonard and Sheldon when they sneak into her apartment and clean it while she is sleeping.

name: The Fuzzy Boots Corollary
description: Leonard gets upset when he discovers that Penny is seeing a new guy, so he tries to trick her into going on a date with him.

name: The Luminous Fish Effect
description: Sheldon's mother is called to intervene when he delves into numerous obsessions after being fired for being disrespectful to his new boss.

name: The Hamburger Postulate
description: Leslie seduces Leonard, but afterwards tells him that she is only interested in a one-night stand.

name: The Middle Earth Paradigm
description: The guys are invited to Penny's Halloween party, where Leonard has yet another run-in with Penny's ex-boyfriend Kurt.

name: The Dumpling Paradox
description: When Howard hooks up with Penny's old friend, his absence in the gang causes problems for the rest of the guys.

name: The Grasshopper Experiment
description: When Raj's parents set him up on a blind date, he finds he can talk to women with the aid of alcohol.

name: The Cooper-Hofstadter Polarization
description: Leonard and Sheldon's friendship is put to the test when Leonard wants to present a paper they co-authored at a physics convention, but Sheldon doesn't.

name: The Loobenfeld Decay
description: Leonard lies to Penny so that he and Sheldon can get out of watching her perform. However, Sheldon believes that the lie has too many loose ends, so he comes up with a new, unnecessarily complex one to replace it.

name: The Pancake Batter Anomaly
description: When Sheldon gets sick, Leonard, Howard and Raj go AWOL, leaving a reluctant Penny to deal with him.

name: The Jerusalem Duality
description: Sheldon decides to give up his work and focus on other tasks when a 15-year-old prodigy joins the university, so the other guys come up with a plan to get rid of him.

name: The Bat Jar Conjecture
description: Sheldon becomes so intent on demonstrating his intellectual superiority over the other guys that they kick him off the Physics Bowl team and replace him with his nemesis, Leslie.

name: The Nerdvana Annihilation
description: Penny gets mad at the guys when their full scale model of a time machine causes her to miss work, which prompts Leonard to give up all of his nerd memorabilia.

name: The Pork Chop Indeterminacy
description: Leonard, Howard and Raj fight over Sheldon's twin sister when she arrives in town. Raj takes part in a drug trial to suppress his selective mutism.

name: The Peanut Reaction
description: When Penny learns that Leonard has never had a birthday party, she and the rest of the guys plan a surprise party for him.

name: The Tangerine Factor
description: After a bad breakup, Penny finally agrees to go out on a date with Leonard, however they both develop doubts and turn to Sheldon for advice.

name: The Bad Fish Paradigm
description: Leonard becomes concerned when his date with Penny ends abruptly and she starts blowing him off. When told the truth, Sheldon would rather move out than keep Penny's reasons a secret from Leonard.

name: The Codpiece Topology
description: Sheldon is annoyed when Leonard turns to Leslie for comfort after seeing Penny with another guy.

name: The Barbarian Sublimation
description: Sheldon introduces Penny to online gaming, however she refuses to quit after becoming addicted.

name: The Griffin Equivalency
description: The guys struggle to cope with Raj's arrogance after he is featured in a People magazine article.

name: The Euclid Alternative
description: Sheldon annoys the gang when Leonard can't drive him to and from work, so they try to teach him how to drive.

name: The Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem
description: Sheldon is flattered when a graduate student takes a shine to him, however her extreme devotion becomes too much to handle.

name: The Panty Pinata Polarization
description: Penny plans revenge when Sheldon bans her from his and Leonard's apartment, while Howard and Raj use the latest technology to try to find the house being used in "America's Next Top Model."""

name: The Lizard-Spock Expansion
description: Leonard and Howard's friendship is jeopardised when Leonard steals a girl from Howard.

name: The White Asparagus Triangulation
description: Sheldon believes that Leonard will wreck his relationship with Stephanie, so he decides to take matters into his own hands.

name: The Vartabedian Conundrum
description: Leonard tries to slow down his relationship with Stephanie when he realizes that they are living together, while Sheldon becomes convinced that he has an untraceable disease.

name: The Bath Item Gift Hypothesis
description: Leonard is disappointed when Penny develops an interest in an attractive physicist at the university. Meanwhile, Sheldon struggles to find an appropriate Christmas gift for Penny.

name: The Killer Robot Instability
description: Howard becomes depressed after Penny makes a cruel statement about his love life, while the rest of the guys prepare for a grudge killer robot duel against an obnoxious colleague at the university.

name: The Friendship Algorithm
description: Sheldon tries to make friends with Kripke in the hope that it will get him access to a coveted computer at the university.

name: The Financial Permeability

name: The Cushion Saturation

name: The Dead Hooker Juxtaposition

name: The Hofstadter Isotope

name: The Classified Materials Turbulence

description: Leonard and Penny's first night together goes awkwardly. Sheldon and Howard wager on the species of a cricket.

name: The Gothowitz Deviation

description: When Raj has to find a new job or be sent back to India, Sheldon's solution leaves Leonard and Penny dealing with Howard as the third wheel.

name: The Cornhusker Vortex
description: Leonard tries to learn about football to fit in with Penny's friends. Meanwhile, a loss in a kite war threatens to end Raj and Howard's friendship.

name: The Guitarist Amplification
description: Sheldon is caught in the middle when Leonard and Penny argue about Penny's friend staying at her apartment.

name: The Maternal Congruence

name: The Speckerman Recurrence

name: The Shiny Trinket Maneuver

name: The Recombination Hypothesis
description: Leonard and Penny contemplate reviving their romantic relationship.

name: The Beta Test Initiation
description: Leonard and Penny develop a system to ensure their dates go smoothly. Raj finally finds a woman he can talk to - the virtual assistant on his mobile phone.

name: The Friendship Contraction
description: Leonard signs out of his roommate agreement, reducing himself and Sheldon to mere acquaintances, while Howard tries to think of a cool astronaut nickname for himself.

name: The Vacation Solution
description: When the university forces Sheldon to use vacation days, he decides to hang out in Amy's lab. Howard becomes upset when he hears Bernadette wants him to sign a prenuptial agreement.

name: The Rothman Disintegration
description: Sheldon battles Kripke for a coveted office at the university. Penny receives a very unusual gift from Amy.

name: The Werewolf Transformation
description: Sheldon wreaks havoc when he tries to get a haircut from his regular barber, who is ill. Howard runs into a few problems with astronaut training.

name: The Weekend Vortex
description: Sheldon has to choose between joining Amy at her aunt's birthday party or playing videogames all weekend with the guys.

name: The Transporter Malfunction
description: Raj gets quite a surprise when he asks his parents to set him up on a date. Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon a pair of Star Trek keepsake collectibles.

name: The Hawking Excitation
description: Sheldon uses any and all means to meet his hero, Dr. Stephen Hawking.

name: The Stag Convergence
description: The guys throw Howard a bachelor party, and some embarrassing details about his life get posted on the Internet.

name: The Launch Acceleration
description: NASA cancel, and later reinstate Howard's mission into space, coinciding with his wedding. Leonard inadvertently jeopardizes his relationship with Penny.

name: The Countdown Reflection
description: As Howard prepares for his mission into space, flashbacks show the recent events leading up to his and Bernadette's wedding.

name: The Date Night Variable
description: Raj crashes Sheldon and Amy's second anniversary and interferes in Leonard and Penny's relationship. Howard gets caught in the middle of an argument between Bernadette and his mother.

name: The Decoupling Fluctuation
description: Penny continues to have doubts about her relationship with Leonard. Meanwhile, Howard becomes the target of practical jokes on the space station.

name: The Higgs Boson Observation
description: When Sheldon hires a female grad student to assist him, a jealous Amy asks Penny to help her spy on them. On the space station, Howard begins behaving erratically.

name: The Re-Entry Minimization
description: Howard is offended when his return from space is met with little fanfare. Penny and Amy take on Sheldon and Leonard during game night.

name: The Holographic Excitation
description: While Raj plans Stuart's Halloween party at the comic book store, Howard annoys the rest of the gang by constantly talking about space, and Penny tries to take more of an interest in Leonard's work.

name: The Extract Obliteration
description: Penny enrolls in a college class and keeps it a secret from Leonard. Sheldon causes conflict with Dr. Stephen Hawking over an online game.

name: The Habitation Configuration
description: Howard makes a decision whether or not to move out of his mother's house, while Sheldon is caught in the middle of an argument between Amy and Wil Wheaton.

name: The 43 Peculiarity
description: Leonard feels threatened after hearing about Penny's study partner at school, while Howard and Raj become determined to find out one of Sheldon's secrets.

name: The Parking Spot Escalation
description: The gang are drawn into a fight between Howard and Sheldon over Sheldon's vacant parking spot at the university.

name: The Fish Guts Displacement
description: Howard tries to bond with Bernadette's father during a fishing trip. When Sheldon is obligated to take care of a sick Amy, she finds ways to take advantage of the situation.

name: The Santa Simulation
description: The girls take Raj out to a nightclub to find him a date. A game of Dungeons and Dragons rekindle old memories of Santa for Sheldon.

name: The Egg Salad Equivalency
description: When Penny finds out Alex has a crush on Leonard, Sheldon gets himself and the rest of the guys in trouble with Human Resources whilst trying to solve the problem.

name: The Bakersfield Expedition
description: The guys are stranded in the middle of nowhere when Leonard's car is stolen on the way to the Bakersfield Comic-Con. Back home, the girls try to figure out why the guys are so fascinated with comic books.

name: The Cooper/Kripke Inversion
description: Sheldon is forced to work with Kripke on a project and must concoct an elaborate lie when he can't hold up his end of the work. Howard and Raj get superhero figurines made of themselves.

description: Leonard moves in with Penny after a fight with Sheldon, which causes Amy to want to move in with Sheldon. Meanwhile, Raj has a frightening experience with Howard's mother.

description: Sheldon gets Alex to buy a Valentine's Day gift for Amy. Leonard, Penny, Howard and Bernadette have a disastrous dinner together. Raj and Stuart host a "Lonely People"" party at the comic book store."

description: Raj falls apart after his date sneaks out on him, and Sheldon reluctantly returns the favor after Penny helps him out with his "Fun With Flags"" program."

name: The Contractual Obligation Implementation
description: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard give lectures on science to junior high students. The girls ditch work to go to Disneyland. Raj devises a date for Lucy that fixes their social anxiety problems.

name: The Closet Reconfiguration
description: Howard becomes upset when Sheldon finds a letter from his estranged father whilst cleaning out his and Bernadette's closet.

name: The Tenure Turbulence
description: Leonard, Sheldon, Raj and Kripke battle for tenure at the university.

name: The Closure Alternative
description: Amy tries to help a depressed Sheldon find closure when one of his favorite TV shows is canceled. Raj becomes paranoid when he finds Lucy's blog.

name: The Proton Resurgence
description: Bernadette and Howard offer to watch Raj's dog and live to regret it. Leonard and Sheldon hire their favorite childhood star to make an appearance.

name: The Love Spell Potential
description: A date between Raj and Lucy takes both of them out of their comfort zones. After a trip to Las Vegas goes awry, the girls join in on a Dungeons and Dragons game, which causes Amy and Sheldon to re-evaluate their relationship.

description: Penny is thrown for a loop when Leonard is offered a job overseas, but the news is an even bigger shock to Sheldon. Raj and Lucy's relationship comes to a crossroad.

description: Sheldon and Penny bond over missing Leonard. Howard tries to help Raj get over his breakup with Lucy. Amy and Bernadette take a trip together to a biology convention.

name: The Deception Verification
description: Sheldon feels betrayed when Leonard returns from the North Sea and wants to spend his time with Penny instead of him. Howard's latest foray into helping his mother has some disastrous side effects.

description: The gang get competitive when they are forced to take part in Raj's scavenger hunt.

name: The Raiders Minimization
description: Sheldon gets mad at Amy for ruining one of his favorite movies, Raj and Stuart try to make their online dating profiles more appealing, and Leonard tries to play the sympathy card with Penny.

name: The Workplace Proximity
description: After a fight with Bernadette, Howard ends up on Raj's couch. Sheldon and Amy clash when Amy takes a job at the university.

name: The Romance Resonance
description: Howard plans something special to celebrate the anniversary of his first date with Bernadette. Sheldon is conflicted when he makes a major scientific breakthrough but some details have to be corrected.

name: The Proton Displacement
description: Sheldon seeks payback when Arthur "Professor Proton"" Jeffries asks Leonard for help on a project instead of him. Raj gets upset at Howard for crashing his night with the girls."

name: The Itchy Brain Simulation
description: Sheldon demands Leonard make up for a mistake from their past. Penny confronts Raj's ex-girlfriend, Lucy.

name: The Cooper Extraction
description: While Sheldon is at home in Texas, the rest of the gang decorate for Christmas and think about how much he has affected their lives.

name: The Occupation Recalibration

name: The Locomotive Manipulation

name: The Friendship Turbulence

description: When Sheldon visits his mother in Houston, he is forced to confront a new reality. Back in Pasadena, the rest of the gang reluctantly take part in Raj's Murder Mystery party.

name: The Indecision Amalgamation
description: While Raj is wracked with guilt when he tries to date Lucy and Emily at the same time, Penny wrestles with whether to take a role in a cheesy movie and Sheldon is torn trying to choose between two gaming systems.

name: The Status Quo Combustion

description: Howard meets the half-brother he never knew he had. Penny is invited to appear on Wil Wheaton's podcast.

name: The Communication Deterioration
description: When Raj is asked to create a message on the off chance a NASA mission discovers alien life, the guys fight over what he should do, while Penny contemplates returning to acting.

name: The Graduation Transmission
description: Howard questions his engineering abilities when he and Sheldon can't get a toy drone to fly. A cancelled flight nearly prevents Leonard from giving the commencement address at his former high school. Raj pits his parents against each other when his father cuts him off financially.

name: The Maternal Combustion
description: Personalities collide when Leonard and Sheldon's mothers meet for the first time. Bernadette reaches her limit with Howard and Stuart.

name: The Commitment Determination
description: As Sheldon presses Leonard and Penny to set a wedding date, he encounters major changes in his relationship with Amy. Meanwhile, Raj wonders if he should break up with Emily, and Howard and Bernadette struggle to ask Stuart to move out.

name: The Matrimonial Momentum
description: Penny struggles with Leonard's confession that he kissed another woman as they prepare to get married in Las Vegas. Meanwhile, Sheldon doesn't know what to do after Amy pushes pause on their relationship.

name: The Separation Oscillation
description: Leonard and Penny try to work through their marital issues. Meanwhile, Sheldon films a special episode of "Fun with Flags"" after his breakup with Amy

name: The Bachelor Party Corrosion
description: The guys's skills are put to the test when they get a flat tire on the way to Mexico for Leonard's bachelor party. The girls throw Penny a mini-bachelorette party.

name: The 2003 Approximation
description: An impending change to his living arrangements inspires Sheldon to revert to 2003, before he met Penny and Leonard. Raj and Howard form a band for the comic book store.

name: The Perspiration Implementation
description: Kripke expresses interest in Amy while leading a fencing lesson for the guys. Meanwhile, Stuart seeks help from the girls in getting more women interested in the comic book store.

name: The Helium Insufficiency
description: Leonard and Sheldon go to great lengths to secure the helium they need during a nation-wide shortage. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang try to find Amy a new boyfriend on a dating app.

name: The Spock Resonance
description: While being interviewed for a documentary about Spock from Star Trek (1966), Sheldon struggles to suppress his emotions about his recent break-up from Amy. Meanwhile, Howard and Bernadette butt heads over renovating his mother's house.

name: The Mystery Date Observation
description: Sheldon, Howard and Raj post an ad online to find a new girlfriend for Sheldon. Penny and Bernadette decide to spy when Amy is secretive about who she is dating.

name: The Platonic Permutation
description: On Thanksgiving, Sheldon and Amy try to spend time together as friends and go to an aquarium, Howard reluctantly agrees to volunteer at the soup kitchen with Bernadette, Raj and Emily, and Penny discovers that Leonard knows more about her than she thought.

name: The Earworm Reverberation
description: Sheldon has a revelation when he realizes why a song was stuck in his head. Meanwhile, Amy invites Dave over for dinner despite their previously awkward date, and Howard and Raj become obsessed with a fan of their band.

name: The Opening Night Excitation
description: Leonard, Howard and Raj have to decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket, while Sheldon plans something special for Amy's birthday.

name: The Sales Call Sublimation
description: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet with a psychiatrist on her behalf to make a sale. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery, and Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived after Stuart moves out.

name: The Empathy Optimization
description: After being forced to deal with a sick Sheldon, the rest of the gang try to treat themselves to a Sheldon-free weekend.

name: The Meemaw Materialization
description: Sheldon is thrilled when his Meemaw comes to visit, but his excitement quickly fades when she butts heads with Amy. Meanwhile, Raj meets a girl at the comic book store who makes him question his relationship with Emily.

name: The Valentino Submergence
description: Sheldon and Amy host a Valentine's Day episode of "Fun with Flags""

name: The Positive Negative Reaction
description: Bernadette reveals her pregnancy to Howard and the rest of the gang.

name: The Celebration Experimentation
description: The gang convince Sheldon to celebrate his birthday and throw him a party.

name: The Application Deterioration
description: Leonard, Sheldon, and Howard run into problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Meanwhile, the girls give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup.

name: The Solder Excursion Diversion
description: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop. Meanwhile, Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie.

name: The Big Bear Precipitation
description: Secrets are revealed when Amy and Sheldon join Penny and Leonard on a weekend cabin trip. Raj is more excited about Howard's and Bernadette's impending parenthood than they are.

name: The Viewing Party Combustion
description: The gang pick sides when a small argument between Leonard and Sheldon erupts into a heated fight during a "Game of Thrones"" viewing party."

name: The Fermentation Bifurcation
description: Sheldon and Bernadette spend the evening together while the rest of the gang go to a wine tasting party, but things get uncomfortable for Raj when Penny's ex-boyfriend Zack shows up and takes an interest in Claire.

name: The Line Substitution Solution
description: Sheldon hires Stuart to spend the day with Amy when he would rather go to the movies. Meanwhile, Penny struggles to make a connection with Leonard's mother when she comes to visit.

name: The Convergence Convergence
description: Leonard and Penny try to have a wedding ceremony that everyone can attend, but it creates serious conflict among Sheldon's mother and Leonard's divorced parents. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj become convinced the government is out to get them.

name: The Conjugal Conjecture
description: As Leonard and Penny attempt to hold another wedding ceremony everyone can attend, they have to deal with Penny's family arriving and Leonard's father spending the night with Sheldon's mother.

name: The Military Miniaturization
description: Howard is visited by an Air Force colonel regarding his invention. Penny accidentally lets it slip about Bernadette's pregnancy to their co-workers.

name: The Dependence Transcendence
description: Bernadette confesses to Raj that she isn't sure if she's ready to be a mother, Penny accompanies Amy to a university mixer, and Sheldon goes to unusual extremes to assist Howard with his military project.

name: The Cohabitation Experimentation
description: When Amy must vacate her apartment for repairs, living arrangements are made with Leonard, Sheldon, and Penny. Howard and Bernadette don't want to know the sex of their baby, but Raj finds out.

name: The Hot Tub Contamination
description: Sheldon and Amy go through a period of adjustment with their new living arrangement. Howard and Bernadette are forced to vacation at home when she falls ill and keep it a secret, unaware Raj and Stuart planned to use their hot tub.

name: The Fetal Kick Catalyst
description: Sheldon and Amy host a brunch. Penny is surprised by her popularity when her movie, "Serial Ape-Ist"" is featured at a Van Nuys comic book convention. Howard starts to freak out about parenthood after feeling the baby kick for the first time."

name: The Veracity Elasticity
description: Amy doesn't tell Sheldon her apartment has been repaired. Leonard finds out Penny is slowly moving all of his collectible toys into storage.

name: The Brain Bowl Incubation
description: A successful gene experimentation leaves Sheldon excited to procreate with Amy, and he pulls out all stops to get her on board. Meanwhile, Raj takes an interest in the cleaning lady at the university.

name: The Geology Elevation
description: Sheldon can't contain his jealousy when Bert wins a grant for his geology research. A distasteful toy built by Howard faces judgement from the gang.

name: The Property Division Collision
description: Dividing up their possessions becomes an all-out war between Leonard and Sheldon. Stuart asks to live with Howard and Bernadette and tries to supplant Raj's efforts to help with the new baby.

name: The Birthday Synchronicity
description: Amy's desire to have an intimate night with Sheldon on her birthday is interrupted by Bernadette going into labor.

name: The Holiday Summation
description: After spending the holidays apart, the gang get together to hear about Sheldon's and Amy's trip to Texas, Leonard's and Penny's Christmas tree adventure, and Howard's and Bernadette's first days as parents.

name: The Romance Recalibration
description: Leonard and Penny ask for Sheldon's and Amy's help on putting the romance back in their marriage. Howard and Raj go to extreme lengths to stop the floor in Halley's bedroom from making noise.

name: The Emotion Detection Automation
description: Penny wants to help her brother get a job with her company. Sheldon learns of a machine that will help him understand human emotions. Raj reunites some of his old girlfriends to figure out why he is still single.

name: The Locomotion Reverberation
description: Leonard and Howard's attempt to keep Sheldon away from their Air Force project by sending him on a train trip backfires. Penny and Amy take Bernadette for her first night out since having the baby.

name: The Allowance Evaporation
description: Sheldon and Amy have their first fight since moving in together. Meanwhile Raj is shocked at the reality of financial independence when he stops receiving support from his father.

name: The Comic-Con Conundrum
description: The guys' annual trip to Comic Con is in doubt when Raj can't afford to go.

name: The Escape Hatch Identification
description: When the gang offer places for Raj to live, it creates unexpected conflict among everyone.

name: The Collaboration Fluctuation
description: Leonard, Penny and Raj adjust to their new living arrangements; Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's work.

name: The Recollection Dissipation
description: Sheldon reaches his limit when he works on projects with Leonard, Howard and Amy in one day. Bernadette has doubts about leaving Halley when she goes back to work.

name: The Separation Agitation
description: Howard and Bernadette have a hard time leaving Halley in daycare when Bernadette returns to work. Bert introduces the gang to his new girlfriend.

name: The Cognition Regeneration
description: Leonard is less than thrilled when Penny considers accepting a job offer from her ex-boyfriend, Zack. Sheldon worries that he hasn't reached his full potential soon enough.

name: The Gyroscopic Collapse
description: After celebrating the completion of the top-secret Air Force project, Leonard, Sheldon and Howard get an unwelcome surprise; Amy receives an offer for a summer position at Princeton as a visiting researcher.

name: The Long Distance Dissonance
description: The gang become concerned when Sheldon's former admirer, Ramona Nowitzki, resurfaces while Amy is away at Princeton.

name: The Proposal Proposal
description: Amy has trouble deciding whether or not she should marry Sheldon. Meanwhile, Bernadette confides in Penny when she finds out some huge news.

name: The Retraction Reaction
description: Leonard angers the University and the Physics Community when he gives an embarrassing radio interview. Bernadette and Amy compare their successes at work.

name: The Relaxation Integration
description: Sheldon and Amy struggle with picking a wedding date. Meanwhile, Stuart and Raj fight over one of Bernadette's co-workers for a date.

name: The Explosion Implosion
description: Howard and Bernadette are disappointed when they find out the sex of the baby. Leonard is annoyed when his mother befriends Penny.

name: The Collaboration Contamination
description: Amy and Howard work in the lab together causing Sheldon, Bernadette and Raj to feel jealous and lonely. Penny starts using a parenting book to control Sheldon's behavior.

name: The Proton Regeneration
description: Sheldon and Wil Wheaton both go head-to-head for the role of the new Professor Proton, Meanwhile Penny takes care of Halley when Bernadette and Howard are on bed rest.

name: The Geology Methodology
description: When Bert asks Sheldon to collaborate on a project with him, Sheldon becomes worried about others finding out because he thinks geology is beneath him. Raj seeks advice after reconnecting with Ruchi.

name: The Tesla Recoil
description: Howard and Leonard become upset after they discover that Sheldon has been working with the military without telling them; Bernadette asks Raj to investigate her suspicions that Ruchi is attempting to take her job away from her.

name: The Bitcoin Entanglement
description: Sheldon tries to teach the other guys a lesson after they cut him out of a potentially valuable Bitcoin investment seven years ago.

name: The Confidence Erosion
description: Sheldon and Amy try to eliminate stress from wedding planning by applying math to the process. Raj and Howard come to blows when Raj begins to feel like Howard hurts his confidence.

name: The Celebration Reverberation
description: Raj and Howard's feud continues as the gang plan Halley's first birthday party. Sheldon's surprise for Amy's birthday goes awry when they get food poisoning.

name: The Matrimonial Metric
description: Sheldon and Amy pick their best-man and maid of honor by experimenting on the gang. Meanwhile, Leonard's self-confidence is still badly damaged after reading his brother's Christmas letter.

name: The Solo Oscillation
description: Sheldon kicks Amy out of the apartment to work solo, and she and Leonard end up bonding during a series of science experiments; Howard is replaced by Bert in Footprints on the Moon.

name: The Separation Triangulation
description: Raj meets a girl at the Planetarium, but soon after finds out she is married. Sheldon rents out his old room to use for his work.

name: The Novelization Correlation
description: Leonard's book raises questions, and Amy guest stars on the new Professor Proton show.

name: The Neonatal Nomenclature
description: When Bernadette won't go into labor, the gang try different tactics to get things started. Also, Wolowitz confronts Bernadette after Amy accidentally reveals she's already chosen their son's name.

name: The Athenaeum Allocation
description: Leonard jumps through hoops to help secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy. Also, Bernadette and Wolowitz have a hard time deciding who should stay at home with the kids and who should go back to work.

name: The Gates Excitation
description: Leonard, Howard and Raj try to meet Bill Gates, who's meeting with Penny to merge their companies; Sheldon thinks he's the victim of an April Fool's prank.

name: The Tenant Disassociation
description: Leonard runs against Sheldon to be president of the tenants association; Wolowitz and Koothrappali find a drone in the backyard.

name: The Reclusive Potential
description: Sheldon takes the guys to a cabin in the middle of nowhere to meet a reclusive scientist; Penny and Bernadette improvise Amy's bachelorette party.

name: The Comet Polarization
description: Sheldon's comic book store experience changes when writer Neil Gaiman puts Stuart's store on the map; friendships are threatened when Koothrappali takes credit for Penny's astronomical discovery.

name: The Monetary Insufficiency
description: Sheldon goes to Vegas to win money for science. Also, Penny and Bernadette take Amy wedding dress shopping, but her terrible choice entangles them in a web of lies.

name: The Sibling Realignment
description: Sheldon and Leonard make a road trip to wrangle a reluctant wedding guest.

name: The Bow Tie Asymmetry
description: When Amy's parents and Sheldon's family arrive, everybody is focused to make sure all wedding arrangements go according to plan - everyone except the bride and groom.

name: The Conjugal Configuration
description: After their wedding, Amy and Sheldon go on their honeymoon.

name: The Wedding Gift Wormhole
description: Leonard and Penny give Sheldon and Amy a baffling wedding gift.

name: The Procreation Calculation
description: The Wolowitzes' life gets complicated when Stuart starts bringing his new girlfriend home. Also, Penny and Leonard talk about starting a family while Koothrappali explores an arranged marriage.

name: The Tam Turbulence
description: Sheldon won't tell anyone why he's never mentioned Tam, his childhood best friend, so Leonard takes matters into his own hands. Also, Bernadette and Penny take out Raj's fiance, Anu, for dinner to get the skinny on her.

name: The Planetarium Collision
description: Amy doesn't have time to work with Sheldon on super asymmetry, so he goes to great lengths to ensure she's available. Koothrappali doesn't want Wolowitz to join him in hosting a show at the planetarium.

name: The Imitation Perturbation
description: When Wolowitz dresses up as Sheldon for Halloween, Sheldon seeks retaliation at Leonard and Penny's Halloween party. Also, Leonard is shocked that Penny doesn't remember their first kiss.

name: The Grant Allocation Derivation
description: Leonard is caught between a rock and a hard place when he's responsible for distributing extra grant money. Also, Bernadette turns the backyard playhouse into a hideaway from her husband and kids.

name: The Consummation Deviation
description: Sheldon tries to bond with Amy's father, but when Wolowitz lures Mr. Fowler away with magic tricks, Sheldon has no choice but to bond with Mrs. Fowler. Also, Koothrappali and Anu try to get physical for the first time.

name: The Citation Negation
description: Sheldon and Amy are devastated after learning from a Russian paper that super asymmetry has already been theorized and disproved. Bernadette wants to beat Howard in a popular video game.

name: The VCR Illumination
description: A VHS tape from Sheldon's past inspires him and Amy not to give up when they're still feeling down about their theory being disproven. Bernadette turns into a pageant mom when she tries to help Howard with his Magic Castle audition.

name: The Paintball Scattering
description: Penny and Leonard organize a paintball game, which results in mayhem when Sheldon becomes jealous of Amy. Raj catches Anu with her ex-boyfriend. Stuart doesn't want to move in with Denise.

name: The Propagation Proposition
description: Penny's ex-boyfriend Zack learns that he is infertile, so he asks Leonard for help; Koothrappali attempts to mend things with his ex-fiancee Anu.

name: The Confirmation Polarization
description: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super asymmetry theory is proven by two physicists, until they try to kick Amy off the Nobel nomination. Bernadette gets one of her drugs approved and wants a reluctant Penny to head the sales team.

name: The Meteorite Manifestation
description: Sheldon is thrilled to help Bernadette and Howard navigate bureaucracy concerning a neighbor's non-compliant balcony until he learns they too have ignored codes. Leonard is disappointed when his friends are uninterested in his new laser.

name: The Donation Oscillation
description: Penny tries to throw a wrench into Leonard's plan to be a sperm donor for her ex-boyfriend; Wolowitz, Bernadette, Anu and Koothrappali turn Koothrappali's canceled bachelor party into a couple's trip aboard the "vomit comet."""

name: The D & D Vortex
description: The gang finds out Wil Wheaton hosts a celebrity Dungeons and Dragons game involving William Shatner, Joe Manganiello, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Kevin Smith. Deception and betrayal are the path to make it to the one open seat.

name: The Conference Valuation
description: Bernadette and Penny travel to San Diego for a pharmaceutical sales convention. Back home, Amy and the guys experiment on the Wolowitz children when Sheldon finds a book on it.

name: The Laureate Accumulation
description: Rivals Pemberton and Campbell charm America on a publicity tour so Sheldon and Amy try to win over Nobel laureates Kip Thorne, George Smoot and Frances Arnold. Halley's fear of the dark causes opportunity and conflict at the Wolowitz home.

name: The Inspiration Deprivation
description: Contemplating what it would mean to all women if she were to win a Nobel Prize causes Amy to have a meltdown. Koothrappali and Wolowitz try to relive the good old days after Wolowitz buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years ago.

name: The Decision Reverberation
description: Koothrappali is worried people won't take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Leonard wants to be the principal investigator on a plasma physics study.

name: The Plagiarism Schism
description: Kripke has proof that Dr. Pemberton plagiarized his thesis in college, and Sheldon and Amy aren't sure if they should turn him in. Wolowitz learns that Bernadette wasn't the only waitress at the Cheesecake Factory who had a crush on him.

name: The Maternal Conclusion
description: Leonard is pleasantly surprised when Beverly comes to visit and she's genuinely kind to him, until he finds out the real reason she's there. Also, Denise and Stuart overstay their welcome at the Wolowitz house.

name: The Change Constant
description: Sheldon and Amy await big news.

name: The Stockholm Syndrome
description: Bernadette and Wolowitz leave their kids for the first time; Penny and Leonard try to keep a secret; Sheldon and Amy stick together; and Koothrappali makes a new friend, as the gang travels together into an uncharted future.

name: Pilot
description: Diagnosed with terminal lung cancer, chemistry teacher Walter White teams up with former student Jesse Pinkman to cook and sell crystal meth.

name: Cat's in the Bag...
description: After their first drug deal goes terribly wrong, Walt and Jesse are forced to deal with a corpse and a prisoner. Meanwhile, Skyler grows suspicious of Walt's activities.

name: ...And the Bag's in the River
description: Walt and Jesse clean up after the bathtub incident before Walt decides what course of action to take with their prisoner Krazy-8.

name: Cancer Man
description: Walt tells the rest of his family about his cancer. Jesse tries to make amends with his own parents.

name: Gray Matter
description: Walt rejects everyone who tries to help him with the cancer. Jesse tries his best to create Walt's meth, with the help of an old friend.

name: Crazy Handful of Nothin'
description: With the side effects and cost of his treatment mounting, Walt demands that Jesse finds a wholesaler to buy their drugs - which lands him in trouble.

name: A No-Rough-Stuff-Type Deal
description: Walt and Jesse try to up their game by making more of the crystal every week for Tuco. Unfortunately, some of the ingredients they need are not easy to find. Meanwhile, Skyler realizes that her sister is a shoplifter.

name: Seven Thirty-Seven
description: Walt and Jesse realize how dire their situation is. They must come up with a plan to kill Tuco before Tuco kills them first.

name: Grilled
description: Walt's disappearance is met with investigation by both his wife and Hank, as Tuco Salamanca intends to leave town with his kidnapped cooks.

name: Bit by a Dead Bee
description: Walt and Jesse try to come up with alibis for their disappearances.

name: Down
description: Skyler keeps mysteriously leaving without talking to Walt. Jesse's parents throw him out of his own house.

name: Breakage
description: Walt and Jesse decide to start their own little empire with the help of Jesse's friends: Skinny Pete, Combo, and Badger. Meanwhile, Hank tries to pull himself together after his encounter with Tuco.

name: Peekaboo
description: After Skinny Pete gets ripped off, Walt makes Jesse go get the money. Meanwhile, Walt's cover story on how Elliott and Gretchen are paying for his medical treatment is on the verge of collapsing.

name: Negro y Azul
description: Rumor is spreading that Jesse killed the man that ripped Skinny Pete off. Walt uses this to his advantage on expanding their territory. Meanwhile, Hank has been promoted to the El Paso office. But it's not all he hoped it would be.

name: Better Call Saul
description: Badger is caught by the DEA. Walt and Jesse hire the best criminal lawyer in town, Saul Goodman.

name: 4 Days Out
description: Walt and Jesse become stranded out in the middle of the desert after cooking more crystal.

name: Over
description: Walt's cancer has greatly improved. Time to celebrate. Meanwhile Jesse tries to meet his new girlfriend's father.

name: Mandala
description: Walt and Jesse's little empire begins to crumble. Saul tries to set them up with a mysterious distributor.

name: Phoenix
description: Walt and Skyler have a baby girl. Now that Jesse is hooked on heroin, Walt refuses to give him his money until he gets clean. Meanwhile, as an excuse for his money, Walt decides to donate the money to himself through his son's new website.

name: ABQ
description: Walt's lies have pushed Skyler to her limit. She leaves with the kids. Meanwhile, Jesse blames himself for Jane's death and goes into rehab.

name: No Mas
description: Skyler goes through with her plans to divorce Walt. Jesse finishes rehab.

name: Caballo sin Nombre
description: Walter, Jr. is having a rough time accepting his parents' separation. Jesse buys his old house from his parents. Meanwhile, two mysterious men have come into town looking for Walt.

name: I.F.T.
description: Walt has moved back into the house without Skyler's consent. Now she can't get him out. Meanwhile, Jesse continues to cope with Jane's death.

name: Green Light
description: Walt's world crumbles even more after finding out that Skyler is cheating on him. Jesse tries to set up a meeting with Gus to try and sell his own version of the blue meth. Meanwhile, Hank is growing obsessed with finding Heisenberg.

name: Mas
description: Gus tries to get Walt back in the business by offering him three million dollars and a brand new lab. Jesse is furious that Walt received half of the money for his blue meth. Hank tries to track down the RV meth lab.

name: Sunset
description: Heisenberg's organized and practical assistant Gale greatly aids his work in Gus's lab. Hank finally tracks the RV back to Jesse, as a concerned Walt finds any way to erase the evidence.

name: One Minute
description: Jesse ends up in the hospital after getting beaten up by Hank. Now he is threatening to press charges against the DEA. To stop him, Walt decides to bring Jesse on as his partner, once again.

name: I See You
description: Hank ends up in the hospital after being attacked by Tuco's cousins. Walt spends too much time by his family's side when he should be cooking meth.

name: Kafkaesque
description: Skyler hatches a plan as Hank's hospital bills stack up. Meanwhile, Walt and Gus come to a better understanding as Jesse, looking for more independence, pursues a new opportunity.

name: Fly
description: There is a fly loose in the lab. Walt and Jesse must do whatever they can to kill it before it contaminates the meth.

name: Abiquiu
description: Skyler gets more involved in Walt's business, much to his chagrin, as Hank struggles with his recovery. Meanwhile, Jesse takes an active role in his new enterprise, leading him to a startling discovery.

name: Half Measures
description: Against Walt's advice, Jesse lashes out. Fearing for Jesse's safety, Walt takes drastic action to intervene. Meanwhile a tragic event leads to a shocking confrontation.

name: Full Measure
description: Jesse has disappeared and Walt is in big trouble with Gus. So Gus rehires Gale to learn from Walt's cooking so that they can dispose of Walt once and for all.

name: Box Cutter
description: Walt and Jesse are held captive for Gus, after Gale's death. Meanwhile, Skyler tries to find out what happened to Walt.

name: Thirty-Eight Snub
description: Walt attempts to form a new alliance as he plans his next move. Meanwhile Skyler pushes Walt towards a business opportunity, in hopes of protecting the family.

name: Open House
description: While Walt worries about Gus's interference and Jesse's increasingly fragile state of mind, Skyler steps up the pressure to get what she wants.

name: Bullet Points
description: As Skyler concocts an elaborate story to explain the Whites' finances, a worried Walt discovers that Hank has begun a new investigation.

name: Shotgun
description: Jesse rides shotgun with Mike on a perilous run of pickups, prompting Walt to worry that his partner is about to be killed.

name: Cornered
description: Skyler adopts an aloof approach when she suspects that Walt isn't telling her the truth. Meanwhile, Jesse proves his worth to Mike and Gus.

name: Problem Dog
description: Skyler looks to continue her family's trend of appearing poverty-stricken by forcing Walt to return the car he bought. A concerned Walt chauffeurs Hank to Los Pollos Hermanos, and the articulate yet immobile DEA agent collects prints.

name: Hermanos
description: When Hank produces evidence that Gus is Albuquerque's crystal meth kingpin, Walt worries that he and Jesse will be killed to protect their boss.

name: Bug
description: While Walt tries to subvert Hank's probe into the Albuquerque meth scene, a deadly warning forces Gus to consider a deal with the cartel.

name: Salud
description: Jesse, Gus, and Mike fly down to Mexico, and Jesse cooks the blue meth for the cartel. Walt misses his son's 16th birthday after his fight with Jesse.

name: Crawl Space
description: Hank asks Walt to drive him to the laundry where the meth lab is hidden. Ted still won't pay the IRS so Skyler asks Saul for help, and Saul sends in his A-Team. Gus and Jesse return from Mexico, and Walt fears he is in trouble with Gus.

name: End Times
description: The DEA is putting Hank and his family in protective custody; however, Walt refuses and awaits his fate in his house. Meanwhile, Brock has fallen terribly ill and Jesse suspects Walt may be behind it.

name: Face Off
description: Jesse is brought to the FBI for questioning on his knowledge of ricin. In a last effort to kill Gus, Walt must ask for help from an old enemy.

name: Live Free or Die
description: Now that Gus is dead, Walt, Jesse, and Mike work to cover their tracks. Skyler panics when Ted Beneke wakes up.

name: Madrigal
description: Walt and Jesse seek out an unlikely partner for a new business venture. The DEA follows up new leads in its investigation.

name: Hazard Pay
description: The guys put a business plan into action; Walt confesses to Marie.

name: Fifty-One
description: It's Walt's 51st birthday. His return to the drug business causes Skyler to go into depression.

name: Dead Freight
description: Walter White's domestic life continues to deteriorate; at the same time, his growing business venture aims to steal a train car chock full of methylamine.

name: Buyout
description: In the aftermath of the train heist, Jesse and Mike decide to quit the business, leaving Walt to handle things on his own. Mike is being followed by the DEA.

name: Say My Name
description: Mike and Jesse are out. Now Walt has to handle things on his own. Hank finally finds a rat in Mike's gang.

name: Gliding Over All
description: Walt expands his business overseas, and the money is pouring in.

name: Blood Money
description: Walt is out of the meth business and trying to move on with his life. Jesse tries to get rid of his money. Hank now knows that Walt is the famous Heisenberg.

name: Buried
description: Hank is determined to bring down Walt. Walt scrambles to hide evidence before Hank gets to it, and Skyler tries to stop Hank and Marie from taking away the kids.

name: Confessions
description: Walt makes his next move against Hank, putting Hank in a tough position. Hank confronts Jesse and attempts to turn him against Walt, and Jesse decides it's time to move on. Meanwhile, Todd has taken over the business.

name: Rabid Dog
description: Walt discovers Jesse broke into his house and attempted to burn it down. Walt wants to protect his family so he moves them into a hotel for a few nights. Jesse makes plans to take down Walt.

name: To'hajiilee
description: Jesse and Hank come up with an idea to take Walt down. Walt hires Todd's uncle to kill Jesse.

name: Ozymandias
description: Walt goes on the run. Jesse is taken hostage. Marie convinces Skyler to tell Walter, Jr. the truth.

name: Granite State
description: Walt struggles as he adapts to aspects of his new identity. Jesse plans an escape against Jack and his crew.

name: Felina
description: Walter White makes one last attempt to secure his family's future, while also visiting some old enemies, during his final return to Albuquerque.
